PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: 10MATH03 - SIDIMEC - Hamiltonian Dynamical Systems and Celestial Mechanics
Dinamica epidemiologica atravщs dos mosquitos Aedes no Rio de Janeiro. O papel do clima e dos turistas
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
O projeto esta dividido em etapas: a) Formulaчуo do modelo SIR-Network e deduчуo dos parтmetros de infecciosidade para epidemia 2007-2008 : b) Analise de existъncia de estado endemico em presencia de infecciosidade que varia periodicamente ou limitatamente no tempo. c) Analise espaчo-temporal da dinamica epidemica atravщs dos dados. d) Analise dos dados climсticos e dos turistas. e) Implementaчуo do modelo SIR-Network com o clima e os turistas
Como comentado na introduчуo, a quantidade de mosquitos depende das condi\cc\tio es ambientais e climсticas: a ovulaчуo da fъmea do mosquito depende da temperatura, uma vez que iria produzir ovos se щ suficientemente quente, e ovos abririam se for suficientemente quente e umido. Alщm disso, os ovos do mosquito pode ser `` armazenados "por algum tempo (atщ dois anos) [Chaves, Honorio] e, portanto, ter clima alternando entre um ano quente e seco com um quente e umido, pode ser bastante catastrofico e favorecer uma `` produчуo " em massa de mosquitos , e, portanto, uma possэvel epidemia de Dengue/Chikungunya /Zika.
Objectivos e metodologia: Na cidade do Rio de Janeiro epidemias de dengue sуo fenєmenos recorrentes [Stolerman, Coombs & Boatto]. Gostarэamos de estudar uma tal "periodicidade", a fim de prever e prevenir epidemias futuras. Para a epidemia do periodo 2007-2008 epidemias, em [Stolerman, Coombs & Boatto] nos jс fizemos a previsуo que o mсximo da infectividade foi durante a semana do Carnaval. Agora nѓs gostarэamos de estender a analise para o periodo de 2000-20014, a fim de detectar quais sуo as condiчѕes mais importantes que agem em sinergia para produzir uma epidemia. O nosso objectivo щ duplo. Primeiro quantificar a relaчуo o entre a incidъncia da dengue e fatores exѓgenos como variсveis ​​climсticas ou fluxo turistico, e, em segundo momento incorporar no nosso modelo anterior as relaчѕes significativas encontradas. O objectivo щ portanto de ser capaz de antecipar uma epidemia e nуo somente para um melhor controle da dengue, mas tambщm da Zika e da Chikungunya, como todas as trъs epidemias sуo propagadas pelas mesmas espщcies de mosquitos (e humanos). Isto permitiria a criaчуo de mecanismos de prevenчуo, tais como um melhor controle de possэveis populaчѕes suscetэveis, incentivar a utiliza\cc\tia o de redes nas janelas, uso de armadilhas para mosquito, uso do ar condicionado para ambientes fechados, limitando a formaчуo de bacias de agua, e, em particular, a utilizaчуo de armadilhas de mosquito [Cabral]. Alщm disso, uma previsуo deste tipo permitiria os hospitais do Rio de Janeiro de melhor se preparar para tratar os pacientes e realizar analises.
Bibliografia : [Chaves] L.F. Chaves, T.W. Scott, A.C. Morrison, T. Takada, Hot temperatures can force delayed mosquito outbreaks via sequential changes in Aedes aegypti demographic parameters in autocorrelated environments, Acta Tropica 129 (2014) 15-24
[Cabral] M. Curiщ Cabral, Garrafa PET, tesoura, alpiste, microtule e fita isolante criam armadilha para mosquito, website FAPERJ of 10/04/2008 http://www.faperj.br/?id=1193.2.9
[Honorio] R.-M. Lana, T.G.S. Carneiro, N.A. Honorio, C.T. Codeчo, Seasonal and nonseasonal dynamics of Aedes aegypti in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil : Fitting mathematical models to trap data. Acta Tropica 129, 25--32 (2014)

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Dinamica de massas e vortices sobre superficies : plano, cilindro & superficies de revoluчao (esfera, elipsoide, fejao)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
One of the today?s challenges is the formulation of the N-body and N-vortex dynamics on Riemann surfaces. In the vortex case there are already formulations of their dynamics over surfaces with constant curvature [1, 8, 11, 12] and more recently, even for surfaces with not constant curvature, and conform to the sphere [2,4]. In the case of the N-body problem the dynamics over surfaces is still a practically unexplored research ﬁeld and the similarity with the N-vortex problem has not yet been fully explored. In recent years a formulation of the N-body problem on a surface with constant curvature has been presented by F. Diacu and collaborators [6, 7]. We propose a formulation of the point-bodies? dynamics directly in the intrinsic geometry of the surface and which makes use of the fundamental solutions of the equation of the gravitational ﬁeld [2, 3]. We obtain the classical version of the equivalence principle : variations of the Gaussian curvature of the surface are equivalent to a force ﬁeld. As a result an isolates mass with initial zero velocity won?t move on a sphere, but it would move on a ellipsoid (even without the presence on a second mass). This is similar to what we have found for the vortices, see [9, 10]
In Rodrigo Schaefer master thesis the dynamics of two bodies was studied. In particular the difference between viewing the plane in its intrinsic geometry and as imbedded in three dimensional euclidean space. The differences were noticeable as in the latter case we have that, among other things, Kepler Laws do apply while they do not in the case of the intrinsic geometry.
What we are now planning to do a more accurate study about the integrability of the 2 body dynamics for surfaces of revolutions such as cylinder, sphere, ellipsoid of revolution and the flat torus [13].
Furthermore we would like to extend the stability analysis of relative equilibria done for the vortices (see [1]-[4]-[5]) to the masses.
Bibliography [1] S. Boatto , Curvature perturbations and stability of a ring of vortices. Discrete Contin. Dyn. Syst. Ser. B, 10, no. 2-3, 349375 (2008).
[2] D. Dritschel and S. Boatto, Vortex dynamics on surface of revolutions, preprint (2014).
[3] S. Boatto, R. Schaefer, D. Dritschel, The N-body, the N-vortices and the N-charges dynamics on surfaces : a common view point, en preparation
[4] S. Boatto and H.E. Cabral, Non-linear stability of relative equilibria of vortices on a non-rotating sphere, SIAM J. of Applied Math, 64, pp. 216-230 (2003)
[5] S. Boatto and C. Simo, Thomson's Heptagon : A Case of Bifurcation at Infinity, Physica D, Vol. 237, Issue 14-17, pp. 2051-2055 (2008)
[6] F. Diacu, Relative Equilibria of the Curved N-Body Problem, Atlantis Studies in Dynamical Systems, vol. 1, Atlantis Press, Amsterdam, 2012.
[7] F. Diacu, R. Martınez, E. Pщrez-Chavela, and C. Simo, On the stability of tetrahedral relative equilibria in the positively curved 4-body problem, arXiv:1204.5729, Physica D (to appear).
[8] Y. Kimura , Vortex motion on surfaces with constant curvature. R. Soc. Lond. Proc. Ser. A Math Phys. Eng. Sci. (1999), vol. 455, pp 245-259.
[9] J. Koiller and S. Boatto, Vortices on closed surfaces, preprint (2009)
[10] S. Boatto and J. Koiller (2014). Vortices on closed surfaces, in ?Geometry, Mechanics, and Dynamics: The Legacy of Jerry Marsden?. D. Holm,D.E. Chang, T. Ratiu and G. Patrick, editors. Fields Communications Series, Volume 73, Springer, New York.
[11] S. Pekarsky, and J.E. Marsden , Point-vortices on a sphere: Stability of relative equilibria. J. Math. Phys. 39, 58945907 (1998).
[12] L.M. Polvani and D.G. Dritschel, Wave and vortex dynamics on the surface of the sphere. J. Fluid Mech., Vol. 255, pp 35-64 (1993).
[13] H. Viglioni, Dinamica de vortices em superficies com aplicaчoes ao problema de dois vortices no toro plano, tese doutorado, IME, USP (2013)

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Nonlinear Stability of a Latitudinal Ring of Point-Vortices on a Nonrotating Sphere
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Nonlinear Stability of a Latitudinal Ring of Point-Vortices on a Nonrotating Sphere

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: We study the nonlinear stability of relative equilibria of configurations of identical point-vortices on the surface of a sphere. In particular, we study how the stability changes as a function of the colatitude $\theta$ and of the number of vortices N. By using the integrals of motion, we view the system in asuitable corotating frame where the polygonal vortex configuration is at rest. Then after a sufficient criterion due to Dirichlet, the stability ranges are the $\theta$-intervals for which the Hessian of the Hamiltonian---evaluated at the equilibrium configuration---is positive or negative definite. We find that the stability intervals coincide with those for linear stability determined by Polvani and Dritschel [J. Fluid Mech., 255 (1993), pp. 35--64]. For $N=3$ we recover the result previously established by Pekarsky and Marsden [J. Math. Phys., 39 (1998), pp. 5894--5907].

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Thomson's Heptagon: A case of bifurcation at infinity

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Vortex modeling has a long history. Descartes (1644) used it as a model for the solar systems. J. J. Thomsom (1883) used it as a model for the atom. We consider point-vortex systems, which can be regarded as ?discrete? solutions of the Euler equation. Their dynamics is described by a Hamiltonian system of equations. We are interested in polygonal configurations and how their stability depends upon various dynamical variables. In the plane a polygon with seven vortices has been shown to be a special boundary case: polygons with N<7 vortices are (linearly and nonlinearly) stable while polygons with N>7 vortices are unstable. Why should N=7 be special? Celestial Mechanics helped us to simplify a problem that has been studied for over a century, and to show that the case of Thomson?s Heptagon is actually a case of bifurcation at infinity. This becomes particularly clear when considering the corresponding problem of a ring on a sphere with two polar vortices of variable intensities, at the North and South Pole, respectively.

In particular, we study and characterize the global planar dynamics of some restricted 3 and 4-vortex problems, as a function of the vorticities Γj of the vortices

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Proceedings - Royal Society. Mathematical, Physical and Engineering Sciences (Print)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A major challenge for our understanding of the mathematical basis of particle dynamics is the formulation of N-body and N-vortex dynamics on Riemann surfaces. In this paper, we show how the two problems are, in fact, closely related when considering the role played by the intrinsic geometry of the surface. This enables a straightforward deduction of the dynamics of point masses, using recently derived results for point vortices on general closed differentiable surfacesMendowed with a metric g. We find, generally, that Kepler?s Laws do not hold. What is more, even Newton?s First Law (the law of inertia) fails on closed surfaces with variable curvature (e.g. the ellipsoid).
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: A major challenge for our understanding of the mathematical basis of particle dynamics is the formulation of N-body and N-vortex dynamics on Riemann surfaces. In this paper, we show how the two problems are, in fact, closely related when considering the role played by the intrinsic geometry of the surface. This enables a straightforward deduction of the dynamics of point masses, using recently derived results for point vortices on general closed differentiable surfacesMendowed with a metric g. We find, generally, that Kepler?s Laws do not hold. What is more, even Newton?s First Law (the law of inertia) fails on closed surfaces with variable curvature (e.g. the ellipsoid).

PALAVRAS-CHAVE.PALAVRA-CHAVE-3: Dinamica de fluidos sobre superficies de Riemann

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Parte de um volume tematico de la Philosophical Transactions of the Royal Society A sobre aspectos geometricos e topologicos de la dinamica de corpos gravitacionais e vortices.
Resumo : The stability of a ring of vortices has attracted the interest of researchers for over a century. Recent beautiful observations of polygonal configurations of vortices present in the atmospheres of Jupiter and Saturn, and of polygonal jets in the Earth?s atmosphere, have revived the interest in the subject. In the observed cases, the vortex ring is in the presence of a central vortex. We present analytical and numerical results about the linear, spectral and Lyapunov stability of a ring in the presence of polar vortices. Motivated by both atmospheric observations we considered the special case of total vorticity equal to zero. Such a case has also the very nice property of being universal, i.e. not depending on a choice of gauge. We considered the two cases of fixed and non-fixed polar vortices. A ring in the northern (respectively, southern) hemisphere is stabilized by the presence of a northern (respectively, southern) polar vortex of suitable strength, in agreement with what is observed numerically and atmospherically.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
The stability of a ring of vortices has attracted the interest of researchers for over a century. Recent beautiful observations of polygonal configurations of vortices present in the atmospheres of Jupiter and Saturn, and of polygonal jets in the Earth?s atmosphere, have revived the interest in the subject. In the observed cases, the vortex ring is in the presence of a central vortex. We present analytical and numerical results about the linear, spectral and Lyapunov stability of a ring in the presence of polar vortices. Motivated by both atmospheric observations we considered the special case of total vorticity equal to zero. Such a case has also the very nice property of being universal, i.e. not depending on a choice of gauge. We considered the two cases of fixed and non-fixed polar vortices. A ring in the northern (respectively, southern) hemisphere is stabilized by the presence of a northern (respectively, southern) polar vortex of suitable strength, in agreement with what is observed numerically and atmospherically.
This article is part of the theme issue ?Topological and geometrical aspects of mass and vortex dynamics?.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: N-body dynamics on an infinite cylinder : the topological signature in the dynamics
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: N-body dynamics on an infinite cylinder : the topological signature in the dynamics

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Volume 25, Number 1 Special issue: In honor of Valery Kozlov for his 70th birthday
RESUMO: The formulation of the dynamics of N-bodies on the surface of an infinite cylinder is considered. We have chosen such a surface to be able to study the impact of the surface's topology in the particle's dynamics. For such a purpose we need to make a choice of how to generalise the notion of gravitational potential on a general manifold. Following Boatto, Dritschel and Schaefer (Proc. R. Soc. A 2016), we define a gravitational potential as an attractive central force which obeys Maxwell's like formulas. As a result of our theoretical -- Differential Galois' theory -- and numerical study -- Poincar\'e sections -- we prove that the two body dynamics is not integrable. Moreover, for very low energies, when the bodies are restricted to a small region, the topological signature of the cylinder is still present in the dynamics. A perturbative expansion is derived for the force between the two bodies. Such a force can be viewed as the planar limit plus the topological perturbation. Finally a polygonal configuration of identical masses (identical charges or identical vortices) is proved to be an unstable relative equilibrium for all $N>2.$ ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The article was published in Volume 25, Number 1 which is a special issue in honor of Valery Kozlov for his 70th birthday

For such a purpose we need to make a choice of how to generalise the notion of gravitational potential on a general manifold. Following Boatto, Dritschel and Schaefer (Proc. R. Soc. A 2016), we define a gravitational potential as an attractive central force which obeys Maxwell's like formulas. As a result of our theoretical -- Differential Galois' theory -- and numerical study -- Poincar\'e sections -- we prove that the two body dynamics is not integrable. Moreover, for very low energies, when the bodies are restricted to a small region, the topological signature of the cylinder is still present in the dynamics. A perturbative expansion is derived for the force between the two bodies. Such a force can be viewed as the planar limit plus the topological perturbation. Finally a polygonal configuration of identical masses (identical charges or identical vortices) is proved to be an unstable relative equilibrium for all $N>2.$ --------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The article was published in Volume 25, Number 1 which is a special issue in honor of Valery Kozlov for his 70th birthday

PALAVRAS-CHAVE.PALAVRA-CHAVE-1: Dinamica de fluidos sobre superficies de Riemann

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: It was recognized, since the seminal papers of Arnold (Ann Inst Grenoble 16:319?361, 1966) and Ebin-Marsden (Ann Math Ser 2 92(1):102?163, 1970), that Euler?s equations are the right reduction of the geodesic flow in the group of volume preserving diffeomorphisms. In 1983 Marsden and Weinstein (Physica D 7:305?323, 1983) went one step further, pointing out that vorticity evolves on a coadjoint orbit on the dual of the infinite dimensional Lie algebra consisting of divergence free vectorfields. Here we pursue a suggestion of that paper, namely, to present an intrinsic Hamiltonian formulation for a special coadjoint orbit, which contains the motion of N point vortices on a closed two dimensional surface S with Riemannian metric g. Our main results reformulate the problem on the plane, mainly C.C. Lin? s works (Lin, Proc Natl Acad Sci USA 27:570?575; Lin, Proc Natl Acad Sci USA 27:575?577, 1941) about vortex motion on multiply connected planar domains. Our main tool is the Green function G g (s, s o ) for the Laplace-Beltrami operator of (S, g), interpreted as the stream function produced by a unit point vortex at s o  ∈ S. Since the surface has no boundary, the vorticity distribution ω has to satisfy the global condition ∬𝑆𝜔𝛺=0, where Ω is the area form. Thus the Green function equation has to include a background of uniform counter-vorticity. As a consequence, vortex dynamics is affected by global geometry. Our formulation satisfies Kimura?s requirement (Kimura, Proc R Soc Lond A 455:245?259, 1999) that a vortex dipole describes geodesic motion. A single vortex drifts on the surface, with Hamiltonian given by Robin?s function, which in the case of topological spheres is related to the Gaussian curvature (Steiner, Duke Math J 129(1):63?86, 2005). Since the surface has no boundary, the vorticity distribution ω has to satisfy the global condition ∬𝑆𝜔𝛺=0, where Ω is the area form. Thus the Green function equation has to include a background of uniform counter-vorticity. As a consequence, vortex dynamics is affected by global geometry. Our formulation satisfies Kimura?s requirement (Kimura, Proc R Soc Lond A 455:245?259, 1999) that a vortex dipole describes geodesic motion. A single vortex drifts on the surface, with Hamiltonian given by Robin?s function, which in the case of topological spheres is related to the Gaussian curvature (Steiner, Duke Math J 129(1):63?86, 2005). Results on numerical simulations on flat tori, the catenoid and in the triaxial ellipsoid are depicted. We present a number of questions, intending to conn

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In recent years, there has been rapidly growing interest in new geometrical and topological approaches to fundamental problems in fluid and mass dynamics, both in the physical science and mathematical communities. This volume includes a sample of the growing literature on this subject. We feel particularly grateful to Hassan Aref and Keith Moffatt who over the years have organized many workshops and mini-symposia on the subject, favouring the mixing of both young and more experienced scientists. In particular, we would like to remember the IUTAM symposia on 150 Years of Vortex dynamics, held at the Technical University of Denmark in 2009, and on Topological Fluid Dynamics, held at the Newton Institute in 2012, which gathered specialists from very different areas. Both were very enriching experiences that motivated us to organize in 2012 the workshop N-vortex and N-body dynamics: common properties and approaches, at the Federal University of Rio de Janeiro, which included the stimulating presence of Florin Diacu. To have Celestial Mechanics, Geometers and Fluid Dynamics researchers join together provided?and still continues to provide?a fruitful and cross-fertilizing environment for researchers from each research group. This kind of collaboration has been ongoing for many years, which is why we feel it is important to also include a historical perspective on the subject.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Dynamics and bifurcation of passive tracers advected by a ring of point vortices on a sphere
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Dynamics and bifurcation of passive tracers advected by a ring of point vortices on a sphere

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: ABSTRACT. We consider the dynamics of a passive tracer, advected by the presence of a latitudinal ring of identical point vortices. The corresponding instantaneous motion is modelled by a one degree of freedom Hamiltonian system. Such a dynamics presents a rich variety of behaviours with respect to the number of vortices, N, and of the ring?s co-latitude, $\theta_o$ ? or, equivalently, its vertical position $q_o = cos \theta_o$. We carry out a complete description of the global phase portrait for the cases N = 2, 3, 4 by determining equilibrium points, their stability, bifurcations with respect to the parameter $\theta_o$ and by characterizing the separatrix skeleton. Moreover, for N ≥ 5 we prove the existence of a value of bifurcation $\theta_{oN}$ such that when $\theta_o = \theta_{oN}$ ($\thea_o = \pi−\theta_{oN}$, respectively) the south (north, respectively) pole becomes a N-bifurcation point, i.e., a symmetric web of N centers and N saddles bifurcates from the corresponding pole.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: ABSTRACT. We consider the dynamics of a passive tracer, advected by the presence of a latitudinal ring of identical point vortices. The corresponding instantaneous motion is modelled by a one degree of freedom Hamiltonian system. Such a dynamics presents a rich variety of behaviours with respect to the number of vortices, N, and of the ring?s co-latitude, $\theta_o$ ? or, equivalently, its vertical position $q_o = cos \theta_o$. We carry out a complete description of the global phase portrait for the cases N = 2, 3, 4 by determining equilibrium points, their stability, bifurcations with respect to the parameter $\theta_o$ and by characterizing the separatrix skeleton. Moreover, for N ≥ 5 we prove the existence of a value of bifurcation $\theta_{oN}$ such that when $\theta_o = \theta_{oN}$ ($\thea_o = \pi−\theta_{oN}$, respectively) the south (north, respectively) pole becomes a N-bifurcation point, i.e., a symmetric web of N centers and N saddles bifurcates from the corresponding pole.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
(convidada para Boris Khesin) Resumo: One of the today's challenges is the formulation of the N-body and N-vortex dynamics on Riemann surfaces. In this talk we address how the two problems are strongly related one another when looking at them from the point of view of the intrinsic geometry of the surface where the dynamics takes place. This is rather different from what had been previously done by F. Diacu and collaborators [1] where the dynamics over a sphere was deduced by viewing the sphere as imbedded in R^3. In the vortex case there are already formulations of point vortex dynamics over surfaces with constant curvature [2,3,4]. In this talk we address the following question : given a surface M of metric g, the distribution of matter S -- viewed as a set of point planets -- on M and its initial position and velocities, is it possible to deduce the dynamics of the masses?
We propose a formulation of the point-bodies' dynamics directly in the intrinsic geometry of the surface. Among other things, we find that in the plane the two masses problem does not obeys to the known Kepler laws. On the sphere not extra additional integrals, quadratic w.r.t. the momenta were found (i.e. there is not the analogue of an extra integral of the Laplace-Runge-Lenz type).
References : [1]F. Diacu, Relative Equilibria of the Curved N-Body Problem, Atlantis Studies in Dynamical Systems, vol. 1, Atlantis Press, Amsterdam (2012); F. Diacu, R. Martinez, E. Pщrez-Chavela, and C. Simo, On the stability of tetrahedral relative equilibria in the positively curved 4-body problem, arXiv:1204.5729,
[2] S. Boatto. Curvature perturbation and stability of a ring of vortices. Discrete and Continuous Dynamical Systems Series B Vol.10, Number 2\& 3, 349--375 (2008).
[3] Y. Kimura. Vortex motion pn surfaces with constant curvature. R. Soc. Lond. Proc. Ser. A Math Phys. Eng. Sci., vol. 455, pp 245-259 (1999).
[4] S. Pekarsky, and J.E. Marsden ,

PALAVRAS-CHAVE.PALAVRA-CHAVE-2: Dinamica de fluidos sobre superficies de Riemann

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract: One of the today's challenges is the formulation of the N-body and N-vortex dynamics on Riemann surfaces. In this talk we show how the two problems are strongly related one another when looking at them from the point of view of the intrinsic geometry of the surface where the dynamics takes place. Given a surface M of metric g, the distribution of matter S on M, we deduce the dynamics of the masses and some of its properties. Among other things, we find that in the plane the two masses problem does not obeys to the known Kepler laws. Moreover, Newton's Laws are not longer verified on closed surfaces with variable curvature.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Abstract: One of the today's challenges is the formulation of the N-body and N-vortex dynamics on Riemann surfaces. In this talk we show how the two problems are strongly related one another when looking at them from the point of view of the intrinsic geometry of the surface where the dynamics takes place. Given a surface M of metric g, the distribution of matter S on M, we deduce the dynamics of the masses and some of its properties. Among other things, we find that in the plane the two masses problem does not obeys to the known Kepler laws. Moreover, Newton's Laws are not longer verified on closed surfaces with variable curvature.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Nos cursos de mecanica baasica uma primeira abordagem рs forчas centrais e, em particular, р forчa gravitacional, щ feita atravщs das leis de Newton e a expressao da forчa gravitacional "newtoniana", F = G m1m2/r^2 'E bom lembrar que a dependencia 1/r^2 na express~ao da forчa щ uma contribuiчao devida as experiencias em R^3 de Hooke (ver, entre outros, o livro de Arnold). Nesta abordagem o potencial gravitacional U(r) (F(x) = -grad(U)) щ derivado a partir do conhecimento da forчa. Como encontrar a expressao da forчa gravitacional quando se estuda a dinamica em outras geometrias? Por exemplo sobre superfIcies? Temos o problema de nao poder realizar experiencias bidimensionais para medir a forчa entre dois corpos e portanto devemos encontrar a resposta as seguintes perguntas : 1) Qual щ a definiчao de forчa central em uma geometria qualquer? 2) Dada a distribuiчao de matщria sobre uma superficie quais sao as equaчoes fundamentais para deduzir o potencial gravitacional? Propomos uma formulaчao da dinamica diretamente na geometria intrinseca da superficie e que utiliza as soluчoes fundamentais da equaчao do campo gravidacional. Vamos mostrar como as equaчoes da dinamica gravitacional estao estritamente ligadas as das cargas elщtricas e as da dinamica de vortices pontuais. Alщm disso, vamos mostrar como leis conhecidas, tais como as leis de Kepler, e alguns axiomas da mecanica (as Leis de Newton) podem depender da geometria do espaчo, i.e. nao sao propriedades universais

N-body and N-vortex dynamics on surfaces: curvature and topological contributions
Stefanella Boatto, Universidade Federal de Rio de Janeiro E-mail address: boatto.stefanella@gmail.com.
One of the today?s challenges is the formulation of the N-body and N-vortex dynamics on Riemann surfaces. In this talk we show how the two problems are strongly related one another when looking at them from the point of view of the intrinsic geometry of the surface where the dynamics takes place. Given a surface M of metric g, the distribution of matter S on M, we deduce the dynamics of the masses and some of its properties. Among other things, we find that in the plane the two masses problem does not obeys to the known Kepler laws. Moreover, Newton?s Laws are not longer verified on closed surfaces with variable curvature. For masses on an infinite cylinder we are able to observe topological effects in the dynamics This is a joint work with David Dritschel, Gladston Duarte, Teresa J. Stuchi, and Renata Loiola. INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The formulation of the dynamics of N-bodies on the surface of an infinite cylinder is considered. The choice of the surface is related to the impact of the topology of the surface in the particle dynamics. For such a purpose we need to make a choice of how to generalize the notion of gravitational potential on a general manifold. Following Boatto, Dritschel and Schaefer (2016), we define a gravitational potential as an attractive central force which obeys Maxwell's like formulas. As a result of our theoretical -- differential Galois theory -- and numerical study -- Poincarщ sections-- we prove that the two body dynamics is not integrable. Moreover, for very low energies, when the bodies are restricted to a very small region of the cylinder, the topological signatures of the cylinder and of the plane are still present in the dynamics. A perturbative expansion is derived for the force between the two bodies. Such a force can be viewed as the planar limit plus the topological perturbation. Finally a polygonal configuration of identical masses (identical charges or identical vortices) is proved to be an unstable relative equilibrium for all N > 2.

The choice of the surface is related to the impact of the topology of the surface in the particle dynamics. For such a purpose we need to make a choice of how to generalize the notion of gravitational potential on a general manifold. Following Boatto, Dritschel and Schaefer (2016), we define a gravitational potential as an attractive central force which obeys Maxwell's like formulas. As a result of our theoretical -- differential Galois theory -- and numerical study -- Poincarщ sections-- we prove that the two body dynamics is not integrable. Moreover, for very low energies, when the bodies are restricted to a very small region of the cylinder, the topological signatures of the cylinder and of the plane are still present in the dynamics. INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The stability of a ring of vortices has attracted the interest of researchers for over a century. Recent beautiful observations show polygonal con gurations of vortices in the atmosphere of Jupiter and Saturn. We present analytical and numerical results about the linear, spectral and Lyapunov stability of a ring in the presence of polar vortices. Motivated by both atmospheric observations we considered the special case of total vorticity equal to zero.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The stability of a ring of vortices has attracted the interest of researchers for over a century. Recent beautiful observations show polygonal con gurations of vortices in the atmosphere of Jupiter and Saturn. We present analytical and numerical results about the linear, spectral and Lyapunov stability of a ring in the presence of polar vortices. Motivated by both atmospheric observations we considered the special case of total vorticity equal to zero.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Borders in Public Health and Mathematical Epidemiology
In Mathematical Epidemiology, infectious diseases are studied using mathematical and computational tools, and mainly focus on infectious disease characteristics within localized populations and geographic regions. However, infectious diseases are not confined to small regions, and rather cross borders, affecting multiple populations, jurisdictions, and governments. In this workshop we will address the mathematical modelling of infectious diseases across borders, at the intersection of mathematical epidemiology and public health. The workshop will provide an important platform for knowledge translation and discussion, enabling (1) the identification of key questions in public health policy that need to be addressed where borders play an important role, and (2) the identification of mathematical models and methods that can be utilized to address key questions, and inform/advance public health policy. The workshop will bring together Canadian and international mathematical epidemiologists and public health decision-makers that work at the forefront of national and international infectious disease research. An important component of this workshop is the inclusion of infectious disease modellers that work in local, federal, and global health organizations, which will allow for important discussion on key issues to do with borders at these regional levels.

PALAVRAS-CHAVE.PALAVRA-CHAVE-1: Dinamica de fluidos sobre superficies de Riemann

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Vortex modeling has a long history. Descartes (1644) used it as a model for the solar systems. J.J. Thomson (1883) used it as a model for the atom. We consider point-vortex systems, which can be regarded as "discrete" solutions of the Euler equation. Their dynamics is described by a Hamiltonian system of equations. In particular we are interested in vortex dynamics on simply connected surfaces of constant curvature $K$ -- i.e. a plane, spheres and hyperbolic surfaces. It is known that polygonal configurations of $N$ point-vortices are relative equilibria of the system. We study the stability of such polygonal configurations, and, more specifically, how stability depends upon the number of vortices $N$ and the curvature $K$ of the surface. To address such a question we have to formulate the problem in a unified geometrical way. The fact that the surfaces of interest can be viewed as K\"alher manifolds greatly simplify our task. Nonlinear stability is then studied by making use of the Dirichlet Criterion. Stability ranges are the $K$- intervals for which the Hessian of the Hamiltonian - evaluated at the equilibrium configuration -- is positive or negative definite.

http://www.sedem.org.ec/emalca2010/
La modelizaciѓn biomatemсtica representa hoy dэa uno de los temas de gran importancia, especialmente para la utilidad de sus resultados. Por ejemplo, la epidemiologэa necesita del modelado matemсtico para dar respuestas precisas sobretodo en lo que dice a respeto de las enfermedades negligidas (dengue, malaria, ...) por grandes conglomerados y a las nuevas enfermedades emergentes (SARS, gripe A,..). En este mini-cursos vamos ver algunas aplicaciones de modelos principalmente de ecuaciones diferenciales.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
A satellite of the thematic program on Partial Differential Equations, the two days conference provided an opportunity for promising young Canadian mathematicians to present their work in a friendly and active atmosphere, to meet each other, and to interact with more senior mathematicians.
Two 45 minutes talks were delivered by senior scientists. N. Kamran (McGill) spoke on solutions of the wave equation problems in the context of general relativity and in particular on his results on wave propagation with Kerr black hole background Lorentzina metric. A. Nachman (Toronto) presented an overview of inverse problems in partial differentialequations. There were twekve 30-minutes talks delivered by junior scientists. There was also a poster session presented by lively joint effort of nine invited junior scientistists: N. Ahmad, R. Akila, W. Bahusoun, M. Harada, Z. Hu, A. Kuznetsov, B. Moore, V. Panferov e S. Lawi. http://www.fields.utoronto.ca/programs/scientific/03-04/pde/young_math/

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Quantitative methods can offer important insights into the study of biological systems. The goal of the minisymposium is to present a broad spectrum of mathematical approaches and applications, working across scales in biology. Topics include:
Protein interactions and design
Biochemical network dynamics
Cancer and stem cells
Bacterial swarming and chemotaxis
Gene regulatory networks
Evolutionary dynamics
Epidemiological models

Minisimposio parte do congresso SIAM Applications of Dynamical Systems http://meetings.siam.org/sess/dsp_programsess.cfm?SESSIONCODE=12492
MS18 Epidemiology, Population Dynamics and Networks I
3:00 PM - 4:40 PM Room: Wasatch B This mini-symposium is about mathematical models for the spread of infectious diseases. The talks concern effects of variabilities of abiotic determinants: spatial heterogeneities or seasonal variations. Particular emphasis is give on how the network structure and the multi-scale dynamics have an effect on the epidemic spreading. Methods of controlling and reducing the epidemic impact, such as vaccination and genetic methods, will also be discussed. Actual applications will be considered.
Organizer: Stefanella Boatto Universidade Federal do Rio De Janeiro, Brazil

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Pagina web do minicurso, 29/10-6/11/2012 http://www.im.ufrj.br/lella/diacu.html
Florin Diacu http://www.math.uvic.ca/faculty/diacu/index.html Pacific Institute for the Mathematical Sciences and Department of Mathematics and Statistics, University of Victoria, Canada
29 e 31 de Outubro, 5 de Novembro as 15h00-17h00, Sala C-116, Instituto de Matemсtica, UFRJ 6 de Novembro, IMPA
Resumo/abstract: The N-body problem in Euclidean space was introduced by Isaac Newton in 1687. Its development helped us understand the motion of cosmic objects, discover new planets, and send humans to the Moon. But the shape of the physical space remains unknown to this day. Is the shortest distance between two points a straight line, as on a flat table, an arc of a great circle, like on Earth, or does it have some other shape? It was therefore natural for Janos Bolyai and Nikolai Lobachevsky, the main founders of non-Euclidean geometry, to define a 2-body problem in hyperbolic space. Since then this direction of research was followed by many mathematicians, such as Ernest Schering, Rudolf Lipschitz, Wilhelm Killing, Heinrich Liebmann, Ernest Schrіdinger, as well as by the Russian school of celestial mechanics. The goal of these lectures is to study the dynamics of a natural extension of the classical N-body problem to spaces of constant curvature K, i.e. spheres for k>0 and hyperbolic spheres for k<0. We will derive the equations of motion via variational methods, analyze their singularities, describe the integrals of motion, find particular orbits, and perform a qualitative study of the system. All the dynamical, geometrical, and topological concepts needed to investigate these equations, such as Clifford tori, hyperbolic cylinders, the Hegaard splitting, or the Hopf fibration will be duly defined, so familiarity with concepts that go beyond the standard undergraduate level is not necessary. This minicourse is therefore be accessible to a wide range of students and researc

http://www.im.ufrj.br/~lella/Nvortex.html
Em homenagem ao Professor Hassan Aref (1950--2011), propomos uma escola/workshop para estudar as relaчѕes fundamentais entre duas сreas de pesquisa afins, a dinтmica de vѓrtices pontuais e a dinтmica de massas pontuais.
Cada uma dessas сrea tem uma longa histѓria prѓpria, que remonta hс varios sщculos, mas nas њltimas trъs decadas, os avanчos tem sido feito mistudando as ferramentas usadas nas duas сreas, inspirados pelo trabalho original de Hassan Aref. O principal objetivo da escola щ reunir pesquisadores mundialmente reconhecidos que trabalham com diferentes aspectos dessas duas grandes сreas de pesquisa. Estes aspectos incluem anсlise cmplexa, dinтmica hamiltonaian (aplicada р dinтmica celeste e р dinтmica dos vѓrtices), sistemas dinтmicos (em dimensѕes finitas e infinitas), mecтnica e simetrias, mecтnica estatэstica, entre outros.
Ambas as сreas tъm varias aplicaчѕes a sistemas fэsicos que occorrem na natureza. Muitas das caracterэsticas fundamentais do movimento de satщlites, planetas, estrelas, atщ mesmo galсxias, podem ser captadas pela dinтmica de massas pontuais. Da mesma forma, muitas das principais caracterэsticas do movimento de fluidos como tempestades atmosfщricas, turbilhѕes oceсnicos, vѓrtices superfluidos, estсgios iniciais de agregaчуo de massa em sistemas gravitacionais podem ser capturadas pela dinтmica de vѓrtices pontuais.
No entanto, sщrios desafios matemсticos permanecem. Sistemas que consistem de mais de alguns vѓrtices pontuais sуo nуo-integraveis, e a complexidade aumenta dramaticamente com o nњmero de partэculas. Alщm disso, a geometria subjacente tem uma profunda influъncia no movimento de partэculas, como sѓ agora se comenчou a investigar. Po exemplo, o comportamento caracterэstico do fluxo do fluido em superfэcies em geral (como filomes de sabуo com diferentes topologias em experimentos em laboratѓrio) ainda щ uma questуo em aberto, e щ particularmente desafiante tanto matematica

http://meetings.siam.org/sess/dsp_programsess.cfm?SESSIONCODE=20722 MS79 Topological Fluid and Mass Dynamics - Part I of II 8:30 AM - 10:30 AM Room: Ballroom 2 For Part II, see MS92
Topological and geometrical methods provide powerful tools for predicting and interpreting the dynamics of fluid flows and interacting masses. This minisymposium will explore recent developments in the use of these methods for considering relative equilibria, modeling interaction dynamics on surfaces, and characterizing structure and transport in complex flows. This minisymposium is dedicated to Konrad Bajer (1956-2014), who made many contributions in this area. Organizer: Stefanella Boatto Universidade Federal do Rio De Janeiro, Brazil Mark A. Stremler Virginia Tech, USA

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Minisiposio : Epidemiology and the Environment Co-organizadora : Anna Mummert (Marshall University, EUA)
The Role of the Environment in Infectious Disease Dynamics The role of the environment is often overlooked in infectious disease models, but indirect pathways may play an important part in the transmission of pathogens causing diarrheal disease, especially in developing regions. The dynamics of the pathogen in the environment?such as persistence, fate, and transport?and the dynamics of human contact with the pathogen?including the dose?response relationship?become important, especially when considering interventions such as water treatment or hand-washing. These modeling strategies also provide an avenue to mechanistically understand how climate change will impact patterns of diarrheal disease in the future.
- Andrew Brouwer (University of Michigan, EUA) Titulo : The Role of the Environment in Infectious Disease Dynamics -- Katy Gaythorpe (University of Bath, UK) Titulo : Disease and disaster: minimising outbreaks of environmentally transmitted diseases after natural disasters -- Stefanella Boatto (IM, UFRJ) Titulo : SIR-Network model : epidemics dynamics in a city & climate variations -- Michael Hayashi (University of Michigan, EUA) Titulo : Modeling adaptation in waterborne disease intervention compliance

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
http://history.icnaam.org/icnaam_2010/Sessions_Minisymposia.htm
Minisymposium (12): "Mathematical Methods in Biophysics and Genomics"
Organizers: Prof. Julie C Mitchell, Departments of Mathematics and Biochemistry, University of Wisconsin - Madison, Madison WI 53703 USA, http://mitchell-lab.org and Prof. Stefanella Boatto, Departamento de Matmeatica Aplicada, Instituto de Matematica, Universidade Federal do Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, BRAZIL, www: http://www.labma.ufrj.br/~lella
E-mail: jcmitchell@wisc.edu and lella@im.ufrj.br
Description of the topic of the session:
Quantitative methods can offer important insights into the study of biological systems, for example by predicting their evolution, as hoped when dealing with cancer therapy. The goal of the minisymposium is to present a broad spectrum of mathematical approaches and applications to epidemiology, protein structures, protein coding, cancer modeling.
Topics of interest include:
Protein interactions and design Biochemical network dynamics Circulation and blood flow Cancer and stem cells Bacterial swarming and chemotaxis Gene regulatory networks Evolutionary dynamics Epidemiological models

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Uma primeira parte do trabalho de mestrado do Pedro щ sobre as equaчoes de transporte e suas aplicaчoes a dinтmica de uma populaчao de celulas foi feita em colaboraчao com a Marie Doumic do INRIA e ENS-Paris na Franca (http://www.dma.ens.fr/~doumic/).
A segunda parte do trabalho, sobre meios porosos, homogenizaчao e equaчoes estocasticas foi feita em colaboraчao com o grupo do Felix Otto da Universidade de Bonn na Alemanha (http://www-mathphys.iam.uni-bonn.de/~otto/web/index-de.htm) and do Antoine Gloria (INRIA, Franчa).
Durante a sua graduacao (em Matematica Aplicada) o Pedro Maia ganhou o primeiro lugar do Insituto de Matematica da UFRJ nas journadas de iniciaчao cientificas em 2005
Quando o Pedro foi aplicar para programas de doutorado ele foi aceito em todos os tres no quais ele fez pedido: University of Oxford, University of Washington em Seattle, University of Heidelberg. Em particular em "University of Washington" e "University of Heildeberg" ofereceram para ele tambem bolsas de doutorado.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: We study one-dimensional homogenization problems where the heterogeneity of the material is modeled by a "random" piecewise constant coefficient. For the elliptic case, we prove decay rates for the average error when the homogenized material is considered instead of the original one. For the diffusive case, we conjecture decay rates based in the scaling of the heat equation and develop a computational strategy to validate it numerically. The results confirm the conjecture and suggest that there is a theorem to be proven in further works.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
A Lucas participa ativamente ao grupo de trabalho sobre teoria do jogo e dinamica de populacoes (http://www.labma.ufrj.br/~lella/PESQUISA.html). O grupo tem caracter interdisciplinar entre o Departamento de Matematica Aplicada (UFRJ), o IESC em colaboraчao com o Roberto Medronho, o Instituto de Biofisica em colaboracao com Prof.a Claudia Lage, a Fundacao Getulio Varga em colaboracao com Prof. Moacyr Alvim, e Universidade de Lisboa em colaboracao com o Prof. Jorge Pacheco (http://www.ciul.ul.pt/~pacheco/).
O Lucas ja participou as Journadas de Iniciacao Cientifica da UFRJ em 2008 com uma apresentacao oral.
Em Fevereiro de 2009 ele participou (com bolsa da propria institucao) a semana de projetos em biomatematica organizada pelo Robertoo Kraenkel (IFT-UNESP, ver http://web.mac.com/kraenkel/MMBPD/Blog_do_Curso_de_Ver%C3%A3o_2009/Blog_do_Curso_de_Ver%C3%A3o_2009.html)
Em julho/agosto 2009 o Lucas fez um mes de estajo no Portugal para um estajo sob a orientaчao do Jorge Pacheco da Universidade de Liboa (a Universidade de Lisboa financiou partialmente a estadia de Lucas).

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
O Bruno fez o curso de EDO comigo em 2007 e tirou a segunda melhor nota da turma (9/10). En 2008 foi meu monitor no curso de EDO e comencou a fazer iniciacao cientifica. Em novembro 2008 ganhou o primeiro lugar no Instituto de Matematica (UFRJ) nas journadas de iniciacao cientifica, chegou em segundo lugar no CCMN (com 9.9/10). Em agosto 2009 entrou no programa de mestrado do Instituto de Matematica da UFRJ.
No final da sua iniciacao cientifica e comenco de mestrado o Bruno comencou a estudar artigos de Richard Mockel sobre O problema de 3-corpos: existencia de orbita a forma de oito

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
A Renata participa ativamente ao grupo de trabalho sobre modelagem matematica epidemiologica (http://www.labma.ufrj.br/~lella/PESQUISA.html).
O grupo tem caracter interdisciplinar entre o Departamento de Matematica Aplicada (UFRJ), o IESC com a participacao do Roberto Medronho, a Fundacao Getulio Varga com a colaboracao do Prof. Moacyr Alvim, e Universidade de Lisboa com o Prof. Jorge Pacheco (http://www.ciul.ul.pt/~pacheco/).
A Renata ja participou as Journadas de Iniciacao Cientifica da UFRJ em 2008 com uma apresentacao oral.
Em Fevereiro de 2009 ela participou (com bolsa da propria institucao) a semana de projetos em biomatematica organizada pelo Robertoo Kraenkel (IFT-UNESP, ver http://web.mac.com/kraenkel/MMBPD/Blog_do_Curso_de_Ver%C3%A3o_2009/Blog_do_Curso_de_Ver%C3%A3o_2009.html)
Em julho/agosto 2009 a Renata fez um mes de estajo no Portugal para um estajo sob a orientaчao do Jorge Pacheco da Universidade de Liboa (a Universidade de Lisboa financiou partialmente a estadia da Renata)
Renata ganhou bolsa de iniciacao cientifica do Banco ITAU (Agosto 2008-Dec. 2010)
